column5: Heading out this morning,I had notice I had used a  quarter tank since tuesday. Since I was getting a coffee and the station was there as well,I decided to fill up the top end of the tank just to see. It cost 33 bux to top it out. I fill to the brim. So full tank to start,I,m now at 235 km. 30 km at pick up,so I have driven 205 km. Is my math off? It works out to me as 7 lt per 100 km. Correct me if Im wrong.
How many litres did you put in?  The best way to do this is to fill the tank, run it until the low fuel light comes on, fill it back up, record how many litres then do the math.
I paid 1.22 a lt Bill.

It will get better once its run in around 2500k. It gets decent mileage regardless which chassis its in, that little 3.6 and 8sp also has more  jam then my seirra with a 4.8 v8 and 4 sp almost unfair lol
At around 10,000 km the milage on my 3.6 showed an improvment of 1-2 litres per 100 km.

I just took a run to Nipissing towing my 19 footer with a 115 and kicker on it and got a respectable 14.5L/100K,2011 V8/4X4 Silverado. I didn't do over 110 KPH, no start and stop on any highway and always run with the towing mode on, always. I can't complain with that at all. When you do the math an extra liter per 100 KMS is about $1.40 per 62 miles. Pennies per mile, but it adds up.  I always put in the high test when pulling the boat for a longer distance. I will put in the good stuff every 3rd fill up as I do very little if any driving over 90 KMH, the entire county doesn't have a 100 KPH highway. I don't know if it matters but I feel it can't hurt, can it?.

Nice truck, you're gonna love it! I just hit 10k on my 14 crew 4x4 with the 3.6. Averaging 10.5L/100km right now and it goes down to 8.5 on the highway.  The price between the HEMI and v6 changes from trim level to trim level. HEMI was an upgrade in the SLT trim.  Mine sure makes closing the cottage easier
Sweet black beauty Brian B!!!  Gotta get a new truck soon too.

I was fiddleing around with the navigations,  and found my usage. As of this morning,it says Im using 11 lt per 100. The only hwy drive was to get it home. Mostly in town and driving back roads at 80 kmh.
Sweet ride Brian. You do know that Dale Jr. drives a Chevy. All kidding aside I just upgraded to an 8 year old Toyota. Liking it so far.

Sweet ride Brian. You do know that Dale Jr. drives a Chevy. All kidding aside I just upgraded to an 8 year old Toyota. Liking it so far.  Dan  You don,t want to know, what they were asking for the same truck .  JR needs to give it his all Saturday night. Need that win.
Toyota makes trucks....  who knew!!!
Toyota makes trucks....  who knew!!!   Dont even get me started what Nissan wanted Gord.
Nice B, too bad it's not a GMC
Believe it or not,the v6 is more then the v8. Only cuz they are more in demand. I didn't play that game with them. LOL  Thanks Joe.
Very nice truck.
Forgot to mention that the bed of that truck will make an excellent "toon storage compartment"! Enjoy the ride Brian. HH
We will see what happens with the new f150 2.7L eco-boost.... The fuel efficiency wars are beginning.... Not to mention the new larger canyon coming with a diesel as well!!
The 3.6 is a nice peppy motor. I have the same motor in my jeep. In the jeep it has 285 HP but I believe in the truck it's tuned to 305 HP.
You guys are correct the Pentastar is actually a 1000 dollar upgrade over the Hemi on a base truck!  Glad you found what you where looking for Brian!
ooohhh that is a very pretty ride...one of these days I'm gonna get me one.  Enjoy  Maureen
Congrats! Gotta feel good, enjoy!!
The ram diesels are selling very well. Believe they put the 2015 GC diesels builds on hold for a bit to keep up to demand on the rams.
Last I just heard they can't keep the Ecodiesels on the lot and can barely keep up with orders.  Looks like they will double the line to accomodate the demand.
Nice ride Brian!!  Congrats!
Last i heard they made 500,000 or so of the eco diesels and the demand was 850,000 or so

My company truck a 2014 Chevy Silverado with 22,000 KM on it is Motor Trends recall truck of the year, just received my 8th recall notice and still counting, looks like GM wants the consumer to be the crash test dummy, from brakes not properly installed, to transmission line installed incorrectly, to side air bags not properly installed and might not deploy during side impact.   LEMON    MOPAR all the way

Thanks again. Reached 200 km today. Needle moved just a tad.   Forgot to mention that the bed of that truck will make an excellent "toon storage compartment"! Enjoy the ride Brian. HH  Joe it,s like this. Lower tail gate. Pull out toon. Load on shoulders. Drop in water and fish. Just like a real boat.
Last i heard they made 500,000 or so of the eco diesels and the demand was 850,000 or so   I have 3 on the lot, sign here please..............................!!!

My company truck a 2014 Chevy Silverado with 22,000 KM on it is Motor Trends recall truck of the year, just received my 8th recall notice and still counting, looks like GM wants the consumer to be the crash test dummy, from brakes not properly installed, to transmission line installed incorrectly, to side air bags not properly installed and might not deploy during side impact.   LEMON    MOPAR all the way Mopar all the way.....now that's  Funny
Dodge has just as many of not more recalls on the current ds series of trucks.  All new vehicles have there share of teething problems when new

Yup!  ^^  Any time an entirely new platform comes out, hiccups are inevitable, and it seems like GM at least handled the recalls fairly well.  We'll see how those highly complex 8 and 9 speeds are doing in 5 years....

Now you guys are just depressing me.       NOT  Ford,Chyrs,GM,Toy,Honda etc, all have their issues.  I work in the auto manufacturing. I know all to well what goes on,   NOW LET ME ENJOY MY NEW RIDE.   Im going
If the stars align in the right order, I'll get one in the future.

Nice ride my man. Nothing beats that new truck smell, well almost nothing. And the feeling of a brand new out of the package new anything, but a truck, even better new. I never bought a new vehicle and I have been killing vehicles for 44 years. My wife(s) had new cars but I never did. After getting some very bad health news my lady was driving us home and we were on Upper James in Hamilton, dealers alley. She pulled into the John Bear GM dealer and told me, " you my dear are getting a new truck ". I did and I love her, my wife too.  I got a 2011 in November of 2011 and I wasn't even thinking about a new truck that winter, my 90 GMC 4X$ short box stepside was fine for another winter. But with the incentives I got a full size Silverado 4X4 crew cab with the chrome package and bigger V8 for more than 10K off the window sticker price.  The price that Ford and Dodge wanted for the similar models was 8K to 15K more. If anyone is thinking about next year for new wheels shop now, you won't be ordering options and section is limited but the prices can't be beat in the fall.  Again, nice ride, love the Black on Black.

Nice rig! My brother has a 1998 F-150 with the 3.9L V6 that still to this day has sufficient "stugatz" to pull his boat full of gear and haul 4 obese dudes 12 hrs north. Always gotten great mileage and totally dependable. No 4 wheel drive or power anything. Just keep a good wax on it. His black on black looks real old (cuz it is!) Congrats man!
Congratulation Brian for your new ride. Now you can put your toon in the trunk without need to deflate. Also you can carry a kayak with that truck..
Thanks again. Yes I got the gold.  The toon slide in,the oars slide right under it and so does all my gear and my front seat is open. LOL  Aan,NO YAK for me.LOL  I had the 97 model  SHP. Manual 5 sp.

The Avenger mopar powered sweet ride was real nice,but she was holding me back. I had a heart to heart with her and said girl,your so fine. Your lines are so slim and sleek. You make me look soooo fly for an old guy. BUT,BUT You need to look for someone younger then I. We said our sad good byes,a tear or two was shed. I watched her slowly roll away,  When she was out of sight,I did the happy dance and said HELLLLOOOOOOO NEW GIRL    She will fill that void I,m sure. I,m so sure,as I forgot all about the other girl as soon as I pulled out of the parking lot. HA HA HA    My new 2014 Ram 1500. 3.6/ V6. Black on Black         Here,s the kicker. All this talk about trucks are gas guzzlers. This one like to sip. 8 speed transmission and the RPM,s never broke 1500 all the way home.  Starting point,401 and Dixie.  Set cruise 105.  Arrive at home.  The gauge never moved      No need for a heavy foot for me. I will get there when I get there.
Maybe the gauge is broken.....  Nice wheels... I should have come home earlier to catch the Sept 30 deal enders on most brands... Leah needs a truck it appears.
Nice looking ride Brian !
Nice ride Brian,knew it was a matter of time.Looks real nice,can't beat black in my books!!!!Congrats!

I just test drove the laramie 3.0l diesel, and loved it!!  Although the truck was too much truck the engine impressed me!  I will be ordering a 2015 1500, the same as you.  Black on Black.  I am a ford boy, but dodge sure hit it out of fenway with this one!  Congrats on the wheels!
nice truck   now       bass boat bass boat bass boat bass boat       bass boat bass boat bass boat      lol
Nice truck!  If I were in the market for a truck, that is the truck I would get!  happy riding.
You may be on to something Terry,no trolling motor,than what?,didn't need a truck ,than what?,it does have to happen,look at the progression.lolol.
yup, it's my master plan  just don't tell him  lol
Sparkling clean !!!! Get that thing dirty will ya! Looks nice. Enjoy it .
Nice machine, but looks like you didn't get 4wd?  You will be happy with that 3.6 for sure, I was impressed when I tried it out
Sweeet!

Thanks fellas.  Lets see how to answer some here.  Wayne. They wanted,I said this is what I will give. Deal. Like said. End of year for these guys. Buyers price.  Davey. Black on black. Always loved it.  Bernie. Thanks. Just dont tell Joe. LOL  anders. I was a ford boy as well. But like you say,they just knock it out.  Hooked. Thanks. It drove smooth. When it the city here on bumpy roads,you know it,s a short box. But Im ok with that,  Ryan. I just got it. Give me atleast a day or two.  Joey. Yes, it is not 4x4. here was my thinking here,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  I wanted a truck that had little to no extras that could go wrong. I tried to find something that was pretty much plane jane. Manual locks,manual windows. 4X4 was IMO just something else that could go wrong and could cost me later on after warranty. I also need something that would get me back to some back lakes that require some height clearance. Thats where the Avenger didnt help me.  With a change in my life style, I can now afford some extra cash to feed the fuel cell when need be for longer trips. I was also surprised that my insurance dropped 130 bucks. That,s another bonus in my favor.  Now for that other guy,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,   NO  NO  NO  BOAT IN MY FUTURE.  THE TOON SERVES ME WELL
ok  who told him      lol

LOL.........you don't realize what you just done.......no 4X4 for now......no bass boat for now....no V8 for now....it's a endless journey we all make sooner or later. As the old commercial once said "pay me now or pay me later"  I'll give you 2 years and you will be looking for a boat and more overtime at work to pay for now's you didn't get yesteryear.....LOL  Enjoy the good mileage "for now"......
If you get stuck, gimme a ring I'll pull you out  Nice rig man!
wow, didnt see that coming...........   sweet ride man. Here you go. http://www.lundboats.ca/boats/boat-guide  window shopping
sweet ride
Nice ride...but might want to invest in a comealong for those back lake trips.

Wow very nice ride B, if you don't mind can you PM me details of what you paid for it? I know what my bro paid for his Ram 1500/4x4 V8 Hemi, just curious how much cheaper the V6 is. I'll be in the market for a truck in a few years when the Escape gets retired.
I believe the hemi is a 2 or 3 grand option over the pentastar

Thanks again.  Hey Bernie,I forgot to tell ya. The battery is in it,s normal spot. Under the hood.   LOL.........you don't realize what you just done.......no 4X4 for now......no bass boat for now....no V8 for now....it's a endless journey we all make sooner or later. As the old commercial once said "pay me now or pay me later"  I'll give you 2 years and you will be looking for a boat and more overtime at work to pay for now's you didn't get yesteryear.....LOL  Enjoy the good mileage "for now"......   I have owned three trucks prior to the Avenger.All 2x4 and 6 cylinders. I have no need for an 8 or hemi. Only once did I get my self in a spot where 4x4 would of been nice to of had.  Andrew and Bill. These are decent trails,just need height like I said.  Now Rick,you stop that.
Congrats on the new truck Brian! Got a fold out ladder to make it easier to get in? LOL Looks good, for a Chrysler! LMAO Now if only the dealership could find a super hero to buy that "Avenger"! HH

I believe the hemi is a 2 or 3 grand option over the pentastar  i don;t think you can get the hemi in a bare bones version like the v6, maybe not even in 2wd.  so i'd imagine after adding all the options, the price is much different.
I think the v6 is more then the basic hemi.  Basic hemi. 6 speed tranny.  V6. 8 speed. Tranny
